main.name: Zachary Leonard
main.description: and recent college graduate in the process of laying down a strong foundation of skills as a developer. I love learning new technologies and diving into whatever's required to solve the problem at hand.
main.bio: I graduated from Biola University in Southern California this past May, and just completed a fantastic internship in Bellingham, WA this summer with Faithlife Corporation. I'm undecided on what path to take in software development long term, and so I'm looking for a place to hone the skills I already have and also grow many new ones, in order to launch into a career equipping me to become a successful and capable software developer in the industry.
main.contactmessage: The best way to contact me is by email! Send one along, or use the contact form below!

education.description: Biola University is a nondenominational private Christian university in Southern California. I deeply valued my time there, and enjoyed the environment that pushed me to excel both academically and personally.

work.title: Software Development Intern
work.description: 12-week paid summer internship. Worked in web development with a 5 member developer team to implement new features and designs using ReactJS, HTML, LESS, and C# in a .NET Core MVC context. Was also a member of a winning internal hackathon team.

work.title: Website Assistant
work.description: Temporary position. Worked to construct short devotionals from existing material and scheduled them to be posted on social media daily through Adobe Social, Tailwind, and Later App services in both a small office setting and remotely from college.

work.title: Administrative Assistant
work.description: Maintained patient health data accuracy and organization in a small office setting, served incoming phone calls to and from doctors and offices, and performed moderate IT assistance and support, including installing and updating a Linux operating system on a workstation.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

projects.title: Resume Website
projects.category: A React based resume website, built on a template by Tim Baker

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
